author: Alicia Mason
title: Mookie Wilson Net Worth
text:
Mookie Wilson Net Worth: From Baseball Player to Successful Businessman
Contents
Introduction Net Worth and Salary Early Life and Education Career Personal Life Real Estate Legacy FAQs 1. What was Mookie Wilson’s salary during his baseball career? 2. How much money did Wilson make from endorsements? 3. What is Mookie Wilson’s biggest business venture? 4. Is Mookie Wilson still involved in baseball in any capacity? 5. What are Wilson’s other investments besides Mookie’s stores? 6. Has Wilson ever been involved in any legal disputes? 7. How has Wilson’s faith influenced his career and personal life? 8. What is Wilson’s advice to young athletes and entrepreneurs? 9. Who are some of Wilson’s closest friends in the baseball world? 10. Was Wilson ever involved in any charitable causes? 11. What is Wilson’s opinion on the current state of baseball? 12. What are some of Wilson’s favorite memories from his playing days? 13. How has Wilson’s relationship with the Mets organization evolved over the years? 14. What advice would Wilson give to his younger self? 15. What is Wilson’s vision for the future? Introduction Mookie Wilson is a former Major League Baseball player turned successful businessman. He has amassed considerable wealth over the years, thanks to his successful career on the field, his business ventures, and his investments. In this article, we will dive into Mookie Wilson’s early life, his baseball career, his personal life, his net worth, and his legacy.
Net Worth and Salary Mookie Wilson’s net worth is estimated to be around $20 million. He made most of his money during his career as a baseball player. Although he wasn’t among the highest-paid players, his contracts with various teams and his endorsement deals brought in a substantial amount of money. After retiring from professional baseball, Wilson embarked on a successful business career, which also helped him increase his net worth significantly.
Early Life and Education William Hayward “Mookie” Wilson was born on February 9, 1956, in Bamberg, South Carolina. His father was a sharecropper, and his mother worked in a cotton mill. Wilson grew up in a humble household, and he had to work hard to make ends meet. Despite the financial difficulties, Wilson’s parents emphasized the importance of education, and he went on to attend the University of South Carolina.
Career Wilson’s baseball career started at the University of South Carolina, where he was a standout player. In 1977, he was drafted by the New York Mets, and he made his debut for the team in 1980. Wilson quickly established himself as an excellent player, known for his speed, defensive skills, and clutch hitting. He played for the New York Mets for ten seasons, earning an All-Star selection in 1986.
Wilson’s most famous moment as a player came during Game 6 of the 1986 World Series. With the Mets trailing the Boston Red Sox by two runs in the 10th inning, Wilson hit a ground ball that went through the legs of Red Sox first baseman Bill Buckner, allowing the tying and winning runs to score. The Mets went on to win Game 7 and the World Series title.
After leaving the Mets in 1989, Wilson played for the Toronto Blue Jays and the Chicago Cubs before retiring in 1991. He then embarked on a career in business, co-founding a chain of successful sports stores called Mookie’s.
Personal Life Wilson has been married to his wife, Rosa, since 1983. The couple has two children, Preston and Ashley. Wilson has been involved in various charitable activities over the years, and he is a committed Christian.
Real Estate Wilson owns a beautiful home in New Jersey, where he has lived for many years. The property has an estimated value of $3 million.
Legacy Mookie Wilson’s legacy in baseball is secure, thanks to his outstanding career and his iconic moment in the 1986 World Series. He is widely regarded as one of the best players in New York Mets history. Wilson’s business ventures have also made him a respected figure in the business world, and he continues to inspire young entrepreneurs.
FAQs 1. What was Mookie Wilson’s salary during his baseball career? Mookie Wilson’s salary varied throughout his baseball career. He made an estimated $1 million during his peak years, but his salary wasn’t among the highest in the league.
2. How much money did Wilson make from endorsements? Wilson made a considerable amount of money from endorsements during his playing days. He endorsed brands such as Nike, Coca-Cola, and Rawlings, among others.
3. What is Mookie Wilson’s biggest business venture? Mookie’s, the sports stores co-founded by Wilson, is his most significant business venture. The stores were a huge success, and they helped him amass a lot of wealth.
4. Is Mookie Wilson still involved in baseball in any capacity? Wilson is no longer involved in baseball in an official capacity. However, he occasionally makes appearances at Mets events and is still regarded as a beloved figure by Mets fans.
5. What are Wilson’s other investments besides Mookie’s stores? Wilson has made several other investments over the years, including real estate and stocks. He has been a shrewd investor, and his investments have always yielded good returns.
6. Has Wilson ever been involved in any legal disputes? There are no reports of Wilson being involved in any significant legal disputes throughout his professional career.
7. How has Wilson’s faith influenced his career and personal life? Wilson is a committed Christian, and his faith has been a significant influence on his life and career. He credits his success to his faith, and he has always tried to live by Christian values.
8. What is Wilson’s advice to young athletes and entrepreneurs? Wilson’s advice to young athletes and entrepreneurs is to work hard, stay focused on their goals, and always be willing to learn. He also emphasizes the importance of having strong values and being true to oneself.
9. Who are some of Wilson’s closest friends in the baseball world? Wilson has many close friends in the baseball world, including several former teammates and coaches. He is highly respected in the industry and has made many lifelong connections throughout his career.
10. Was Wilson ever involved in any charitable causes? Wilson has been involved in various charitable causes over the years, including organizations that support underprivileged children and families in need.
11. What is Wilson’s opinion on the current state of baseball? Wilson has been critical of some aspects of modern baseball, including the increasing emphasis on analytics and the declining importance of traditional scouting methods. However, he also acknowledges that the game has evolved and encourages players to adapt to the changing landscape.
12. What are some of Wilson’s favorite memories from his playing days? Wilson has many fond memories of his playing days, including winning the 1986 World Series and the thrill of playing in front of loyal Mets fans.
13. How has Wilson’s relationship with the Mets organization evolved over the years? Wilson’s relationship with the Mets organization has always been strong, and he remains a beloved figure among fans. He has occasionally worked as a special assistant to the team and has always been supportive of the organization.
14. What advice would Wilson give to his younger self? Wilson would tell his younger self to enjoy every moment and not to take anything for granted. He would also remind his younger self to focus on the things that matter most in life, such as family and faith.
15. What is Wilson’s vision for the future? Wilson’s vision for the future is to continue to grow and evolve as a businessman and to make a positive impact on the world. He also hopes to inspire future generations of baseball players and entrepreneurs.

author: Israel National News
title: Touching: Holocaust survivor and evacuee from the north at the Western Wall
text: During World War II, Simon Hayat and his family miraculously escaped the clutches of the Nazis. Simon lived with his family in Rabat, Morocco at the time, and they were included in the deportation lists prepared by the Nazis for deportation to concentration camps. Just before the Germans arrived in the city, Allied forces arrived and saved Simon and his family. Since his immigration to Israel, Simon has lived with his family and children in the town of Shlomi on the northern border. When the war broke out, the town was evacuated, and Hayat was taken to the Hadassim nursing home in Beit She'an – where he stays to this day with his wife. Simon had one dream he wished to fulfill more fervently since the beginning of the war – to visit the Western Wall with his family. Due to his medical condition and the great distance, Simon has not visited the Western Wall in Jerusalem since the days of the Second Lebanon War in 2006 – about 18 years ago. The Ezer Mizion Association stepped in to help fulfill Simon's dream. The nursing department, along with the patient transportation and mobility department, brought Simon and his wife in a special ambulance from Beit She'an to the Western Wall plaza. Simon's extended family, who were also evacuated from northern towns, also came to the Western Wall and gathered together to fulfill Simon's wish. Simon was able to touch the stones of the Western Wall and pray, with the Western Wall Heritage Foundation also participating in organizing the emotional meeting. Hayat concluded with great excitement: "Since the Second Lebanon War, I have not had the opportunity to come and pray at the Western Wall. This year, as we are out of our homes – I finally had the chance to come to the Wall and pray for the people of Israel during these difficult days. I also finally got to meet my extended family, who have been scattered throughout the country since the beginning of the war." "We managed to defeat Hitler and the Nazi evil – we will also manage to defeat the evil of Sinwar and Hamas together. Being here today is part of our great victory." Naomi Mizrachi, manager of the Make-A-Wish Foundation at the Ezer Mizion association, stated "Each wish fulfilled for a Holocaust survivor is a world unto itself. We see the happiness and joy on their faces when we arrive on-site and the impact that follows. After long days and years of being confined within the institute, they get moments of grace and comfort in their last years as we constantly work to fulfill more and more wishes for the Holocaust survivors living among us. This is a kindness we owe them."

author: 汝平　刘艳侠
title: 亳州：携手添新绿 共筑生态梦
text:
今年3月12日是我国第47个植树节，在亳州市区林拥城义务植树活动现场，到处是忙碌的身影。
“绿水青山就是金山银山，每年这个时候，我都会积极投入到植树活动当中，感觉特别有意义，希望大家在阳春三月多植树，为我市生态文明建设出一份力。”志愿者蒋成友说。
志愿者李景铁表示，种树不仅能美化环境，还能防止水土流失，希望大家共同为药都大地添新绿，为子孙后代谋福祉。
“植树节的意义不仅是植树，更是通过植树节来提升公众参与生态文明建设的意识，为美丽亳州建设作出自己的一份贡献。”亳州市林业技术推广中心副主任王影说，亳州市在市全民义务植树网上，发布了近10项义务植树活动项目，包括造林绿化、抚育管护、自然保护、认种认养、设施修建、捐资捐物、志愿服务等，欢迎广大市民参与。
据介绍，2025年，亳州市造林绿化工作主要有三项内容，全面实施绿美江淮行动，推进森林质量提升行动，深入挖掘亳州市古树名木资源，为明年开展第四次古树名木普查做好准备。（记者 汝平 通讯员 刘艳侠）

author: Zayan
title: Aptos Price Surges to $5.82 & Mantle Rebounds; BlockDAG Prepares to List on 10 CEXs-$20 Coin Value Next?
text:
Things are looking quite favorable in the crypto market. Aptos’ price has surged to $5.82, thanks to an unofficial community takeover (CTO). Trading activity and buying interest have also increased as the coin continues to capture the attention of influencers. Meanwhile, MNT has reemerged after a short period of dip, with the latest Mantle price analysis hinting at a smooth upward path.
Adding to the excitement, BlockDAG (BDAG), which has raised over $199 million in presale with over 18.6 billion coins sold, is set to list on 10 major Centralized Exchanges (CEXs). These highly awaited listings are set to boost its current batch 27 price of $0.0248 per coin to a whopping $20 by 2027, unlocking massive ROIs for holders who join the network’s presale now!
Community Takeover Triggers Aptos Price Surge
Following a recent Aptos price surge, APT is currently residing at $5.82. And guess what triggered it? An unofficial community takeover (CTO) led by crypto influencer BuzzlamicJihad. Most community takeover happens with abandoned projects, but Aptos is actively being developed.
The CTO started in October 2024, with people using memes and catchphrases like “Aptos lookin’ good here,” which spiked social media engagement and buying interest. This Aptos price surge comes after hitting a low of $5.50, a price level strongly defended by buyers. Trading activity has spiked by 13.42% and continues to get a great deal of attention from influencers. And the new CEO, Avery Ching is in full support of this, referring to BuzzlamicJihad as the “GOAT.”
Mantle Price Analysis: What’s Next After a 3.76% Surge?
Despite a brief dip, Mantle (MNT) has rebounded, showcasing resilience with a 3.76% price increase and $121.4 million in trading volume over the past 24 hours. With a market cap of $3.557 billion, and market dominance of 0.1157%, Mantle is slowly but surely marking its presence in the crypto world.
Additionally, Mantle’s price analysis signals the potential for continued growth, with SMA and RSI supporting this possibility. If Mantle holds firm against the resistance level of $1.2730, it could soar high and set new records.
BlockDAG’s CEX Listings Near—Here’s What $20 Forecast Means for Holders
There is hardly a way that a crypto enthusiast hasn’t heard about BlockDAG. This emerging altcoin giant has been garnering consistent institutional confidence since its presale began—raising $199 million and selling over 18.6 billion coins, marking its position as a breakout crypto of this year.
Now, things are about to take an exciting new turn for BlockDAG buyers as the coin prepares to launch on 10 major Centralized Exchanges (CEXs). Having made an impressive mark in the crypto world already, BDAG will likely witness mass adoption once it lists on these exchanges, expanding its reach to millions of traders worldwide. This widespread adoption will also significantly boost the credibility and liquidity of the coin, as the BDAG community expands.
The price of BlockDAG has already seen impressive growth so far, experiencing a 2380% jump since its first crypto presale batch. But the real game is just about to begin. The coin is currently priced at $0.0248 in Batch 27 and once it launches its mainnet in 2025, its price is set to surge significantly, potentially even reaching $20 by 2027.
These numbers highlight how quickly BDAG is growing, with no signs of slowing down. This message is perfectly captured in the network’s newly released CGI video, where a laser shoots into the sky—a metaphor for BDAG’s ambition to go beyond limits, aiming for the sky—or perhaps even the Moon!
Decision Time
The Aptos price surge continues to gain steam, with an increase in traction on social media and buying interest. Meanwhile, Mantle is establishing a presence in the crypto market, with a market dominance of 0.1157%. To make things better for Mantle, price analysis suggests continued bullish momentum for the coin.
While established players see an upward trend, BlockDAG, which has raised over $199 million across just 27 presale batches, is set to accelerate its journey by listing on 10 major CEXs. While early adopters of this breakout crypto are already seeing a 2380% price surge, listing on CEXs could further take its price to $20 in the next two years. So for crypto enthusiasts looking for the next big thing, BlockDAG is the perfect opportunity—especially while it’s still priced at just $0.0248 per coin!

author: Daniela Tostón
title: Previsión meteorológica en Palma: alerta naranja por lluvias y tormentas
text: Previsión meteorológica en Palma: alerta naranja por lluvias y tormentas Consulta el tiempo de hoy según AEMET: temperaturas, lluvias y más detalles meteorológicos Palma (Islas Baleares) estará en alerta naranja por lluvias y tormentas este viernes, teniendo en cuenta que la [Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (AEMET)](http://www.aemet.es/es/eltiempo/prediccion/avisos?w=hoy) ha activado el aviso en el sur de Mallorca. El pronóstico meteorológico apunta a cielos muy nubosos con tormenta desde la madrugada hasta las 06:00 horas, después desaparecerá la posibilidad de tormentas y se reducirá la nubosidad para dar paso a un ambiente de intervalos nubosos con lluvia escasa hasta las 18:00 horas y muy nuboso hasta la caída de la noche. Durante la mañana se producirán lluvias débiles que descargarán un máximo de 0.1 litros por metro cuadrado (alrededror de las 11:00 horas); estas mutarán a precipitaciones consistentes durante la tarde. Asimismo, pueden producirse tormentas durante la mañana y es muy probable que aparezcan en la segunda mitad del día. Las temperaturas máximas de hoy experimentarán pocos cambios en comparación con las de la jornada pasada, situándose en los 23 grados, mientras que las mínimas seguirán sobre los 18 (con una sensación térmica de 24 grados máxima y 16 mínima). En esta fecha vendrán vientos flojos de dirección nordeste. El gráfico que a continuación se expone indica cómo evolucionará el tiempo a lo largo de la semana en Palma. De izquierda a derecha, se representa el día correspondiente, el estado del cielo predominante, la probabilidad de precipitaciones y las temperaturas mínimas y máximas. El tiempo de mañana Por otro lado, mañana será un día nuboso con lluvia desde la madrugada hasta mitad del día, aunque la nubosidad se reducirá a partir de las 12:00. Las temperaturas en Palma experimetarán pocos cambios con respecto a las de hoy, con valores máximos en torno a los 25 grados y mínimos de 16 (con una sensación térmica máxima de 24 grados) . El tiempo de pasado mañana Para el domingo existiría probabilidad de precipitaciones , ya que desde la madrugada imperará un panorama con nubes para ceder ante un cielo de intervalos nubosos con lluvia escasa en la otra mitad de la jornada. Las temperaturas no cambiarán demasiado, registrando un valor máximo de 24 grados y una mínima de 15 . El viento, de dirección sur, estará apaciguado. El tiempo en otros municipios Respecto a otros municipios próximos, se esperan cielos muy nubosos con lluvia en [Manacor](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-manacor-viernes_3995089/), sin cambios durante el trascurso del día. La AEMET vaticina precipitaciones fuertes a partir de las 09:00 y alrededor de las 13:00. El mercurio de los termómetros oscilará entre los 14 grados de mínima y los 22 de máxima. El tiempo en [Castelldefels](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-castelldefels-viernes_3995092/) vendrá marcado por cielos muy nubosos con lluvia hasta las 12:00 y cielos muy nubosos con tormenta durante el resto del viernes. Se pueden producir lluvias débiles, con mayor probabilidad a las 08:00 y a las 15:00. En lo que respecta a las temperaturas, la mínima estará por debajo de 14 grados centígrados y la máxima será de 22. Esta es la previsión meteorológica en otras localidades: [L' Hospitalet de Llobregat](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-l-hospitalet-de-llobregat-viernes_3995093/)[Barcelona](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-barcelona-viernes_3995091/)[Tarragona](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-tarragona-viernes_3995161/)[Sabadell](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-sabadell-viernes_3995094/)[Castellón de la Plana](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-castellon-de-la-plana-viernes_3995099/)[Gandia](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-gandia-viernes_3995166/)[Torrevieja](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-torrevieja-viernes_3995080/)[Albacete](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-albacete-viernes_3995068/)[Elche](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-elche-viernes_3995076/)[Oria](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-oria-viernes_3995084/)[Pamplona](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-pamplona-viernes_3995143/)[Jaén](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-jaen-viernes_3995126/)[Huelva](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-huelva-viernes_3995124/)[Níjar](https://www.elconfidencial.com/el-tiempo/2024-11-01/el-tiempo-en-nijar-viernes_3995083/) * Datos del tiempo en Palma con información elaborada utilizando, entre otras, la obtenida de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (AEMET). En cualquier caso, esta información debe considerarse provisional a la espera de próximas actualizaciones. Palma (Islas Baleares) estará en alerta naranja por lluvias y tormentas este viernes, teniendo en cuenta que la [Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (AEMET)](http://www.aemet.es/es/eltiempo/prediccion/avisos?w=hoy) ha activado el aviso en el sur de Mallorca. El pronóstico meteorológico apunta a cielos muy nubosos con tormenta desde la madrugada hasta las 06:00 horas, después desaparecerá la posibilidad de tormentas y se reducirá la nubosidad para dar paso a un ambiente de intervalos nubosos con lluvia escasa hasta las 18:00 horas y muy nuboso hasta la caída de la noche.

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Haiti's Vital Port Shuts Down Amid Escalating Gang Attacks | Law-Order
text: Haiti's Vital Port Shuts Down Amid Escalating Gang Attacks Access to a critical port in Port-au-Prince is closed due to gang-related violence. Caribbean Port Services shut down barriers, affecting land-based traffic from Sept. 26 to Sept. 29. The shuttering comes amid increased kidnappings and threats to incoming ships, exacerbating Haiti's instability and economic woes. [Devdiscourse News Desk](https://www.devdiscourse.com/devdiscourse-stories)| Updated: 27-09-2024 03:20 IST | Created: 27-09-2024 03:20 IST Land access to a vital supply port in the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince is closed off after attacks by armed gangs, operator Caribbean Port Services (CPS) announced on Thursday. CPS stated that barriers would be shuttered for all land-based traffic from Sept. 26 to Sept. 29, to enable the army and national police to secure the area. A shipping official revealed that ships faced shooting incidents, preventing them from docking and unloading containers. Authorities also reported the kidnapping of two Filipino crew members from a cargo vessel. During the United Nations General Assembly this week, Haitian leaders highlighted the deteriorating security situation despite the partial deployment of a U.N.-backed security force. Armed gangs, predominantly equipped with U.S. weapons, now control most of Port-au-Prince and are spreading to adjacent areas. Over 700,000 people in Haiti have been internally displaced, nearly double the figure from six months ago, as food prices and hunger rates soar. Haiti's transition council president, Edgard Leblanc Fils, at the U.N. General Assembly, called the situation a national threat and urged the Security Council to enhance the Kenyan-led security force into a formal peacekeeping mission. Earlier this year, Haiti's main seaports and international airport shut down for nearly three months when violence peaked in February, causing widespread chaos including prison breaks and the prime minister's resignation. (With inputs from agencies.) author: December
title: Mental Health Toll From COVID Epidemic Continues, by Chuck Norris | Creators Syndicate
text: "As one day blurs into the next and one month into another, the consequences of sustained stress can rise to the surface in subtle ways," I wrote roughly two years ago at the dawning of the New Year of 2022. I was speaking about the then effects coming out of two long years of pandemic life and of various expert assessments of the negative consequences of prolonged stresses it has brought on and the call for keeping optimism alive. As we now stand at the threshold of 2024, I thought it might be of value to look back at the assessments of two years ago to see how they stack up with current perspectives of where we are at today. In commenting to The New York Times on the struggles many people were experiencing during the long-haul of the pandemic, organizational psychologist Adam Grant made the following observation: "It wasn't burnout — we still had energy," he says. "It wasn't depression — we didn't feel hopeless. We just felt somewhat joyless and aimless... It turns out there's a name for that: languishing ... a sense of stagnation and emptiness. And it might be the dominant emotion of 2021." Grant goes on to label languishing as "the neglected middle child of mental health." It fills a void but is given little attention. "You don't have symptoms of mental illness, but you're not the picture of mental health either. You're not functioning at full capacity," he concludes. "'Not depressed' doesn't mean you're not struggling. 'Not burned out' doesn't mean you're fired up. By acknowledging that so many of us are languishing, we can start giving voice to quiet despair and lighting a path out of the void... It appears to be more common than major depression — and in some ways it may be a bigger risk factor for mental illness." In a contribution to an NPR New Year advice series focused on 2022, producer and podcaster TK Dutes points out the damaging role that "the hypercritical mental chorus we call negative self-talk" was creating mental roadblocks to positive actions and mental well-being. On that subject, the Mayo Clinic adds that "if the thoughts that run through your head are mostly negative, your outlook on life is more likely pessimistic... Such an outlook can magnify the negative aspects of a situation and create a condition where you automatically anticipate the worst." Daisy Fancourt, an associate professor at University College London and a leader of a 2022 University College London COVID-19 Social Study, says "if there's any silver lining to the psychological upheaval of the pandemic, it's greater mental health literacy. People were forced to grapple with their own understanding of mental health... their ability to recognize their own symptoms and feelings or potential mental health problems. COVID has been its own campaign about mental health." So where has this campaign focusing on mental health led us? Apparently, we are now squarely in the grips of a new epidemic. It is "seeping in at the corners of our communities," writes USA Today's Adrianna Rodriguez. "It can't be treated using traditional therapies even though it has debilitating and even deadly consequences." It "is by no means new to the human experience. But experts say it has worsened in recent years," she adds. The problem she speaks of is loneliness. As U.S. Surgeon General Dr. Vivek Murthy recently explained to USA Today, "As researchers track record levels of self-reported loneliness, public health leaders are banding together to develop a public health framework to address the epidemic. ... It is detrimental to mental and physical health, leading to an increased risk of heart disease, dementia, stroke, and premature death." According to Dr. Jeremy Nobel, founder of The Foundation for Art and Healing, a nonprofit that addresses public health concerns through creative expression, "The world is becoming lonelier and there's some very, very worrisome consequences. ... It won't just make you miserable, but loneliness will kill you," he concludes. It is a universal human experience, notes Murthy. "It occurs when the connections a person needs in life are greater than the connections they have. Because it's so subjective, not everyone feels loneliness the same way or for the same reason." "Even those who have plenty of friends can experience loneliness," reports Rodriguez. "It can also be exacerbated by technology taking the place of human interaction and it often pushes us to distance ourselves from others at a time when we need support most." Nobel, who is also on the faculty at Harvard Medical School and Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, adds that loneliness is experienced throughout a person's lifespan. "It can spiral as a result of trauma, illness and the effects of aging. It can also be exacerbated by technology taking the place of human interaction, which helps explain why young people report the highest rates of loneliness." These factors also make it difficult to address "as a population health topic because it's so varied based on the circumstances individuals have to navigate." In a recent New York Times report, Izzy Boring, 21, a college student in Oregon, points out that what her generation considers connection — a small screen in our hands — "doesn't have anything to do with connecting at all. ... Genuine connection is found in being human and giving room for others to be human alongside you," she says. What's remarkable is how pervasive loneliness is, the surgeon general tells the Times. "One in 2 adults in the U.S. are living with measurable levels of loneliness — it's a broader swath of the population than the number of people with diabetes ... Tackling the nation's loneliness epidemic will require that all sectors of society work together with a common goal," says Murthy. "We can't take on a lot of these challenges alone. We need to be together. We need to be connected. That's what strengthening the social fabric in our lives and communities is all about." Write to Chuck Norris ( [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)) with your questions about health and fitness. Follow Chuck Norris through his official social media sites, on Twitter @chucknorris and Facebook's "Official Chuck Norris Page." He blogs at http://chucknorrisnews.blogspot.com. To find out more about Chuck Norris and read features by other Creators Syndicate writers and cartoonists, visit the Creators Syndicate webpage at www.creators.com. Photo credit: [Sasha Freemind](https://unsplash.com/photos/silhouette-of-a-woman-with-pink-and-purple-sky-nXo2ZsKHTHg) at Unsplash

author: La Gazzetta dello Sport
title: Ciclismo, domenica 23 dal Vigorelli la Randonnée "Gran Milan" | Gazzetta.it
text:
Domenica 23 torna il fiore all'occhiello della della società Genova 1913: partenza e arrivo nel mitico velodromo milanese
Il grande raduno di domenica prossima è il fiore all’occhiello della società Genova 1913, quella con i colori arancio e blu (simili al Genoa calcio, ma è solo una coincidenza, perché il riferimento è al rione Porta Genova di Milano), che a gennaio ha compiuto 112 anni. Il 23 marzo si svolgerà la settima edizione della Randonnée “Gran Milan”, per la seconda volta con a fianco anche il nome di “Vigorelli”: oltre 350 iscritti fra soci “genovini” e amatori di altre società provenienti da tutta Italia. Per il secondo anno consecutivo, appunto, partenza dentro al mitico velodromo Vigorelli, dove sulla pista velocissima in legno, quella dei record dell’ora, si sono sfidati i più blasonati campioni del ciclismo mondiale. Ma una delle grandi novità di quest’anno sarà l’arrivo: di nuovo dentro al Tempio del ciclismo milanese con il suono della leggendaria campanella dell’ultimo giro. Inoltre, la possibilità per i non ciclisti, di effettuare una visita guidata al velodromo Vigorelli.
ICONA
—È la cosa che più fa esultare il presidente dell’antica società milanese, Giancarlo Scalmana, un ultraottantenne in splendida forma, e soprattutto un appassionato con una carriera da amatore di tutto rispetto: "Una decina di anni fa il FAI organizzava delle visite guidate all’interno del Vigorelli, con un successo di pubblico notevole, anche di persone non proprio amanti del ciclismo. Perché il Vigorelli, a Milano, è un monumento iconico normalmente chiuso al pubblico. Per questo abbiamo pensato di riproporre, in scala minore, la medesima formula. I partecipanti, mentre i ciclisti pedaleranno in diversi percorsi in Brianza, verranno condotti da guide esperte del Comitato Velodromo Vigorelli alla scoperta dei segreti di questa pista considerata magica per quasi un secolo. Sarà un modo per percorrere i novanta anni di storia: dalla prima gara, alla rinascita dopo la distruzione dei bombardamenti del ‘44, ai concerti dei Beatles (due esibizioni nello stesso giorno, il 24 giugno 1965, ndr), al periodo d’oro durato sino al 1985, ai recenti progetti di rilancio"..
L'INIZIATIVA
—Scalmana si riferisce soprattutto alla storia del SC Genova 1913 ASD, quando era una polisportiva e la gloria se l’era appuntata sul petto anche grazie al nuoto, all’atletica e al pugilato. Attraverso più di un secolo, la maglia arancio e blu l’hanno indossata almeno in venticinquemila, un gruppone da cui spuntano i nomi illustri di Alfredo Binda, il più famoso, o di un altro Alfredo, Sivocci, tricolore fra i dilettanti e vincitore di alcune tappe al Giro (la prima nel 1911, l’ultima nel 1924). Racconti epici tramandati di generazione in generazione nella sede storica del club in Via Marostica 4.
La settima edizione della Gran Milan porterà gli iscritti a spasso per la Brianza. Avrà il percorso classico su strada da 200 Km (2200 m di dislivello) e 130 Km (con 1100 m), con omologazione per i brevetti ARI AUDAX, valido per il campionato regione Lombardia FCI. Due percorsi gravel da 130 (1100) e 90 Km (650 m), che attraversano le campagne della Brianza comasca fino ad arrivare, nel percorso lungo, al confine con la Svizzera, con omologazione per i brevetti ARI AUDAX, valido per il campionato regione Lombardia FCI. E, altra novità, 2 percorsi light da 70 km strada e 50 km gravel, meno impegnativi, aperti ad amatori in possesso di semplice certificato medico non agonistico senza obbligo di iscrizione a società sportive. Sarà possibile utilizzare anche una e-bike. Per tutti i dettagli cliccate questo link https://www.genova1913.it/la-granmilan/gm-vigo-2025-presentazione.html
La Gazzetta dello Sport
© RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA
